00039 template <unsigned D> class Box;

00041 template <unsigned D> class Ball: public BallBase {
00042 public:
00043   Ball ();
00044   void draw ();
00045   void step (double dt);
00046   
00047 protected:
00048   void DrawBall (const Vec<D> &center, double r, 
00049          const Vec<4> &rgba);
00050 
00051   Vec<D> x, v; // , phi, omega;
00052

00054   template <unsigned d> friend bool touch(const Ball<d> &, const Ball<d> &, double = 0.);

00057 
00058 template <unsigned D>
00059 bool touch(const Ball<D> &ball1, const Ball<D> &ball2, double dist=0.) {
00060   Vec<D> X = ball1.x;           //  deviation to avoid bickering about 'discarding const qualifiers'
00061   X -= ball2.x;
00062   return (X.norm () <= ball1.r+ball2.r+dist);
00063 }
00064 
00065 
00066 template <unsigned D>
00067   void Ball<D>::DrawBall (const Vec<D> &center, double r, 
00068               const Vec<4> &rgba) {
00069   glPushMatrix();
00070   glTranslatef( center[0], center[1], center[2] );
00071   glScalef( r,r,r );
00072   glMaterial( rgba[0], rgba[1], rgba[2], rgba[3]);
00073   //  i have NO idea why, but the line 'if (ball == 0) ball = MakeStone ();'
00074   //  in the c'tor is NOT executed. so i have to do it again here. not pretty,
00075   //  but effective. when i understand the behavior, i will change it. 
00076   if (ball == 0) ball = MakeStone (numSegments);
00077   glCallList (ball);
00078   glPopMatrix();
00079 }

00085 template <unsigned D>
00086   void Line (const Vec<D> &x0, 
00087        const Vec<D> &x1) {
00088     glBegin( GL_LINES );
00089       glVertex3f(x0[0],x0[1],x0[2]);
00090       glVertex3f(x1[0],x1[1],x1[2]);
00091     glEnd();
00092   }
00093 
00094 //  DrawHypercube (Dimension, vertices[])
00095 //  draws a hypercube with given vertices on the grounds that any hypercube
00096 //  is a cube stretched in an additional dimension; a cube is a square pulled
00097 //  apart, a hypercube a cube pulled apart and so on.
00098 //  DrawHypercube draws the (two) cubes a dimension lower (recursively calling
00099 //  itself), and then finishes with drawing the connecting lines which resulted
00100 //  in pulling the cubes apart along the new dimension.
00101 
00102 template <unsigned D>
00103   void DrawHypercube (int d, Vec<D> x[]) {
00104     if (d > 1) {
00105       unsigned subhypercubesize = 1<<(d-1);
00106       DrawHypercube (d-1, x);
00107       DrawHypercube (d-1, x+subhypercubesize);
00108 
00109       for (unsigned i = 0; i < subhypercubesize; i++)
00110     Line (x[i], x[i+subhypercubesize]);
00111     }
00112     else Line (x[0],x[1]);
00113   }
00114 
00115 
00116 template <unsigned D> Ball<D>::Ball ():
00117   BallBase (), x (), v () {
00118   if (ball == 0) ball = MakeStone ();
00119   for (int i = 0; i < D; i++) {
00120     x[i] = 2.*rnd ()-1.; v[i] = rnd ()-.5; 
00121   }
00122 }
00123 
00124 template <unsigned D> void Ball<D>::step (double dt) { x += v*dt; }
00125 
00126 template <unsigned D> void Ball<D>::draw () {
00127   static Vec<4> color (1., 0.5, 0.1, 1.0);
00128   static double distance = 0.;
00129 
00130   if (D > 3) {
00131     Vec<D> xproj;
00132     double projf;
00133     Box<D>::project (D, x, 1., xproj, projf);
00134     DrawBall (xproj, r*projf, color*projf);
00135   }
00136   else {
00137     const double dmax = sqrt (double (D));
00138     DrawBall (x, r*(dmax-distance)/dmax, color);
00139   }
00140 }
